intro: Synaphea parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered synaphea, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related shrubs. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Synaphea parviflora is adapted to dry conditions and is an important component of the fynbos vegetation in its native range.
